revised_title: X-ray Scattering Method Reveals Protein Structure
tldr: The authors used an x-ray scattering method to study the structure of thirty proteins and two synthetic polypeptides. They found that the intensity curves fall into three different types, suggesting that a common polypeptide-chain configuration, the alpha-helix, is present in most proteins. The method provides a simple and quick way to test various protein structure hypotheses.
